sense.name: take in a liquid orally
sense.commentary: NOTE: while alcohol is a liquid, there is a specific sense for consumption of alcoholic beverages; see sense 2
sense.examples: Drink lots of water on a hot day. At the picnic the children drank lemonade. The colt drank its milk thirstily. The cut roses are drinking their water nicely. (figurative extension) Bob drank three glasses of orange juice.

sense.name: intake alcohol
sense.commentary: NOTE: this is a subsense of sense 1; the "alcohol" is often omitted from the sentence, but is inferred NOTE: compare carefully to sense 4
sense.examples: His father drank himself to death. His religion forbids him to drink or smoke. The two sailors drank themselves into a stupor in one of the little bars along the docks. The woman drinks and beats her kids. I have stopped drinking for lent. I don't smoke, I drink occasionally.

sense.name: complete mental immersion or fascination with something
sense.examples: We stood on the cliffs, drinking in the view of the Pacific Ocean. He drank in her words of love.

sense.name: a toast
sense.commentary: NOTE: examples in this sense may be subsets of sense 2 if drinking alcohol is done for a toast, choose this sense
sense.examples: I'll drink to that! Let's drink to the happiness of the bride and groom.

sense.name: a quality of taste, as with wine
sense.commentary: Note: describes how something tastes to someone
